feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 17 at 6:47AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: Areas of freezing drizzle have been reported around the Anchorage and Matanuska Valley areas this morning. This freezing drizzle is mostly being absorbed into the snow, but snow-free areas of the roads could get more slick than normal. Windshields can also ice- up with the freezing drizzle as well.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Anchorage; Matanuska Valley

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 17 at 5:17AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Significant Snowfall Possible Sunday night to Tuesday... Heavy snowfall is possible Sunday night into Tuesday across the Central and Eastern Interior, including Fairbanks. Snowfall amounts of 6 to 12 inches will be possible over the two days. This weather system will also bring some warmer air into the area and the potential for some freezing rain, especially southwest of
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Denali; Eastern Alaska Range; Middle Tanana Valley; Upper Koyukuk Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country; Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands

cap:geocode.value: AKZ219 AKZ220 AKZ221 AKZ222 AKZ223 AKZ224 AKZ225 AKZ226

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 17 at 5:07AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Series of storms will impact the area into next week... A weather system moving through the Bering Sea will reach the Lower Yukon Delta this morning spreading snow to the area through the day. Snowfall with this system will spread north and east into Saturday with 3 to 8 inches of snowfall south of the Bering Strait by Saturday morning, with 1 to 4 inches of accumulation
entry.cap:areaDesc: Baldwin Peninsula and Selawik Valley; Chukchi Sea Coast; Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Lower Koyukuk and Middle Yukon Valleys; Lower Yukon Valley; Northern and Interior Seward Peninsula; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Upper Kuskokwim Valley; Yukon Delta

entry.title: Winter Storm Watch issued December 17 at 2:47AM EST until December 19 at 7:00AM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...FIRST ACCUMULATING SNOW FOR THIS SEASON IN SOME AREAS... .Low pressure will enter the Ohio Valley Saturday before redeveloping near Cape Cod Saturday night. It will then move out to sea Sunday morning. The first plowable snow of the year is expected for many areas. The steadiest snow will fall Saturday night.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Interior Cumberland; Coastal Cumberland; Coastal York; Interior Cumberland Highlands; Interior York; Southern Oxford

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued December 17 at 8:54AM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...COLD WEATHER WILL CAUSE ICE FORMATION ON THE MISSOURI RIVER... With another stretch of cold temperatures in store through the weekend and into next week, the Missouri River is making another attempt to initiate ice along the Burleigh and Morton counties reach of the river. Ice sheets are moving through the Bismarck and Mandan area of the river. What is uncertain is whether or not these ice
entry.cap:areaDesc: Burleigh; Morton

entry.title: Winter Storm Watch issued December 17 at 2:47AM EST until December 19 at 7:00AM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...FIRST ACCUMULATING SNOW FOR THIS SEASON IN SOME AREAS... .Low pressure will enter the Ohio Valley Saturday before redeveloping near Cape Cod Saturday night. It will then move out to sea Sunday morning. The first plowable snow of the year is expected for many areas. The steadiest snow will fall Saturday night.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Belknap; Cheshire; Coastal Rockingham; Eastern Hillsborough; Interior Rockingham; Merrimack; Northern Carroll; Northern Grafton; Southern Carroll; Southern Coos; Southern Grafton; Strafford; Sullivan; Western And Central Hillsborough
